insight.title: Delivery Risk

status.subtitle: Delivery variability vs typical conditions
status.confidence_reason: Traffic and short-term rain outlook are available.

insight.summary: External conditions suggest delivery timing may vary with traffic and short-term rain risk.
implications: Higher delivery ETA variability can increase customer frustration and remake risk.
If conditions worsen, batching deliveries may trade speed for reliability.
supported_considerations: Consider slightly longer quoted ETAs when risk is Elevated/High.
Prioritize closer zones if conditions deteriorate.
If rain probability rises, expect slower rider availability and curbside delays.

suggested_actions.action: Add a small buffer to quoted delivery ETA
suggested_actions.why: Reduces late-delivery complaints when external variability is high.

suggested_actions.when: If traffic ratio < 0.75 or rain pop â‰¥ 0.30
suggested_actions.why: Shorter distances are less sensitive to external slowdowns.

insight.outlook: Outlook (0â€“3h): Conditions can shift quickly; re-run the pipeline closer to service.
insight.trust_note: This insight uses only external conditions (traffic/weather). No internal order data is used.

insight.title: Late Arrival Risk

status.subtitle: Arrival punctuality risk for the next 0â€“3 hours
status.confidence_reason: Traffic and weather outlook are available; confidence depends on short-term traffic volatility.

insight.summary: Late arrivals may become more frequent due to volatile traffic and/or weather amplification.
implications: Higher probability of customers arriving late, causing table-sequencing friction.
Increased variance in seating times can cause knock-on delays during busy periods.
supported_considerations: Traffic volatility affects punctuality more than steady congestion.
Rain risk can increase both travel friction and unpredictability.

suggested_actions.action: Send a soft check-in message shortly before reservation time
suggested_actions.why: Reduces uncertainty and allows re-sequencing if guests report delays.

suggested_actions.action: Use slightly wider buffers for groups of 5+ when volatility is high
suggested_actions.why: Large groups amplify the operational cost of late arrivals.

suggested_actions.action: Avoid scheduling back-to-back reservation start times during peak
suggested_actions.why: Reduces cascading delays when arrivals cluster or slip.
suggested_actions.tradeoff: May reduce peak throughput, improves experience

insight.outlook: Outlook (0â€“3h): Conditions are likely to remain similar in the near term.
insight.trust_note: This insight is based entirely on external conditions (traffic, weather, timing, location). No internal reservation or customer data is used.

insight.title: Logistics Cost Pressure Risk

status.subtitle: External cost signals look stable.
status.confidence_reason: Food inflation series available (BCRPData). Transport cost proxy series available (BCRPData). FX series available; volatility computed from recent daily data.

insight.summary: External indicators (food inflation, transport cost pressure, and FX volatility) suggest how likely suppliers are to reprice or tighten terms in the coming weeks.
drivers: Macro cost indicators are within normal ranges; repricing risk appears low.
implications: Higher cost pressure can reduce price-lock windows and increase quote variability.
Margin sensitivity rises on imported or freight-heavy inputs during Elevated/Critical periods.
supported_considerations: Focus on menu-margin awareness rather than predicting exact ingredient costs.
Be cautious with promo commitments that depend on volatile inputs when risk is Elevated/Critical.
Re-check supplier quotes closer to order time during higher-pressure periods.

suggested_actions.action: Review margin exposure on high-cost dishes
suggested_actions.why: Cost pressure often hits a few key inputs first (proteins, dairy, imported items).

suggested_actions.action: Avoid locking large forward orders without price confirmation
suggested_actions.why: Higher volatility can shorten supplier quote windows.

suggested_actions.action: Delay promotions that rely on imported inputs
suggested_actions.when: If FX volatility driver is present
suggested_actions.why: FX-driven repricing can compress margins unexpectedly.

insight.trust_note: This card uses Peru-wide macro indicators (BCRPData) as upstream proxies; it does not use restaurant purchase invoices.

insight.title: Reservation Flow Risk

status.subtitle: Compared to a normal evening
status.confidence_reason: Traffic baseline and weather context are available; confidence depends on short-term volatility.

insight.summary: Arrival times are less predictable than usual, increasing the risk of overlapping reservations during peak service hours.
implications: Higher likelihood of reservation overlap and queue spillover during peak hours.
Greater sensitivity to delays for larger groups.
supported_considerations: Wider buffers for larger groups may reduce cascading delays.
Greater flexibility during peak windows may be more valuable than usual.
Proactive expectation-setting may reduce frustration if delays occur.

suggested_actions.action: Add a buffer for groups of 5+ during the next 3 hours
suggested_actions.when: Any booking in the next 3 hours for 5+ guests
suggested_actions.why: Large groups create longer seating/ordering latency and amplify small arrival delays.

suggested_actions.action: Proactively confirm late arrivals with a soft message
suggested_actions.why: Reduces uncertainty and helps resequence tables if someone is running late.

suggested_actions.action: Avoid tight back-to-back reservations during peak window
suggested_actions.why: When arrivals cluster, tighter sequencing increases queue spillover risk.
suggested_actions.tradeoff: May reduce peak throughput, improves experience

insight.outlook: Outlook (0â€“3h): Conditions are likely to remain similar in the near term.
insight.trust_note: This insight is based entirely on external conditions (traffic, weather, timing, location). No internal reservation or customer data is used.

top_actions.action: Send a soft check-in message shortly before reservation time
top_actions.why: Reduces uncertainty and allows re-sequencing if guests report delays.

top_actions.action: Proactively confirm late arrivals with a soft message
top_actions.why: Reduces uncertainty and helps resequence tables if someone is running late.

top_actions.action: Use slightly wider buffers for groups of 5+ when volatility is high
top_actions.why: Large groups amplify the operational cost of late arrivals.

rollups.summary: Elevated risk tonight: disruptions are likely; prioritize buffers and proactive messaging to protect reservations.
